notes.title: Welcome to Lokus
notes.content: This is a sample note to help you get started with the Lokus publishing template. You can customize this template to match your personal style and preferences.
notes.htmlContent:
This is a sample note to help you get started with the Lokus publishing template. You can customize this template to match your personal style and preferences.

Features

  • Beautiful, responsive design
  • Dark mode support
  • Graph visualization
  • Tag organization
  • Fast performance

notes.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
notes.content: Learn how to write notes in Markdown format. Markdown is a lightweight markup language that makes it easy to format text.
notes.htmlContent:
Learn how to write notes in Markdown format. Markdown is a lightweight markup language that makes it easy to format text.

Basic Syntax

  • Bold: Use **text** or __text__
  • Italic: Use *text* or _text_
  • Code: Use `code`

Links

You can create links to other notes using wiki-style [[links]] or standard markdown links.

notes.title: Customization Guide
notes.content: Learn how to customize your published site by editing themes, colors, and layout. The template uses CSS variables for easy customization.
notes.htmlContent:
Learn how to customize your published site by editing themes, colors, and layout. The template uses CSS variables for easy customization.

Color Scheme

Edit the CSS variables in index.css to change colors:

--accent-primary: #8b5cf6;
--bg-primary: #ffffff;

Typography

Customize fonts by changing the --font-family variable.

notes.title: Knowledge Management Best Practices
notes.content: Tips and strategies for organizing your personal knowledge base effectively.
notes.htmlContent:
Tips and strategies for organizing your personal knowledge base effectively.

Organization Strategies

  1. Use descriptive titles: Make note titles clear and searchable
  2. Tag consistently: Develop a consistent tagging system
  3. Link related notes: Create connections between ideas
  4. Review regularly: Revisit and update your notes

Benefits

  • Better information retention
  • Faster knowledge retrieval
  • Improved understanding through connections

notes.title: Setting Up GitHub Pages
notes.content: A guide to publishing your notes to GitHub Pages automatically.
notes.htmlContent:
A guide to publishing your notes to GitHub Pages automatically.

Steps

  1. Create a GitHub repository
  2. Enable GitHub Pages in repository settings
  3. Configure the GitHub Actions workflow
  4. Push your data.json file
  5. Wait for the deployment

Your site will be live at https://username.github.io/repository
